author: gurukamath
content: I am trying to run the evmone statetests and some of the json fixtures in the release seem to have non-standard values/missing fields. For example, I saw fixtures with null `prestate`, missing `currentRandom`, some type 3 txs missing accessLists etc. Is this expected and should I make some assumptions about those values while running? Or will it be fixed in an upcoming release?

author: pdobacz
content: Hey, I think there may be non-standard stuff in this release. If the test doesn't concern EOF I think this can be ignored (sorry about the noise). That release of extra tests is just to complement EOF testing, while we migrate the coverage to EEST. We'll see about filtering these out. Are there many occurrences of these?

author: pdobacz
content: ok, I can see at least where the null prestate is coming from. If you have the non-standard cases listed in some kind of a test run output, pls dm them to me, I'll look into how to best rectify this.

author: _shemnon
content:
Posted two more fuzz findings for geth - https://github.com/ipsilon/eof/issues/146
Hopefully this PR -  https://github.com/MariusVanDerWijden/go-ethereum/pull/53 - will make Geth EOF format fuzz-proof.  61M iterations so far.
